author: ITs HxC TOASTER

text: Wow, I can't believe you included this. Ha ha, I was the guy who would read all the other guys' comments of how they got nostalgia and all that from songs you've posted, and I'd always scoff because I thought you all played the "mainstream" games and no one would give a care for the obscure ones. But here you are, playing Glover, one of the most fun I've ever had playing it with my sister on those sunny Saturday and Sunday afternoons. Now I can politely eat my words. Thank you for posting.

author: The142Mark

text:
@Treck96 

you're supposed to get somewhat close to the giant monkey while he's a swinging on the branch and bounce slap the ball into him. This will make him loop around the branch and fall down so you can fist slam him. Next you've got to hightail it away because he's gonna give chase and try to slam YOU! When he does he'll go back to his branch and you repeat the process 2 more times, all the while avoiding the smaller chimps who will try to steal your ball.

author: Conor Molloy

text: Just listening to this music and playing the game, i get nostalgia memories, Im about to cry. I wasnt around the 80s or early 90s, i was born 1996. The N64 has that kind of music where you get a lot of nostalgia thoughts around that time. Its a heart warmin feeling and I love to have those thoughts. I feel so jealous for the people who were around the time to witness NES, SNES, N64, Genesis, and more before Microsoft and Sony hit the scene. If only i can go back to the past :(
